items.content_html:
beginners will probably know the traditional function expression more, so the arrow function express is converted to it to enable better education

Summary

Converted all arrow function expression to traditional function expressions.

Motivation

There are two function expressions in the tutorial, which is confusing for beginners. The traditional function expression is more known to beginners, hence I converted all the arrow function expression to traditional function expression to facilitate better learning.

Supporting details

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: more consistent function expressions for beginners

items.content_html:
Summary

lineTo methods in the roundedRect utility function are not really doing anything. Removing them does not affect the visual output and straight lines can already be drawn with the arcTo method when the radius is 0.

Motivation

Having those lines of code that don't really do anything might confuse some beginners. I was following the tutorial myself and I was a bit confused as to why these methods are there when they don't affect the visual output when removed.

Supporting details

https://codesandbox.io/s/mdn-canvas-tutorial-roundedrect-1we9z?file=/index.html

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • [x ] Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Remove lineTo from roundedRect

items.content_html:
Summary

The button is automatically labelled by its content. The label element does not change that but, for example in VoiceOver on Safari, attaches the label text to the content, which results in an announcement like “off on Speaker power, on” (the last “on” coming from the ARIA status).

Motivation

The current example is misleading.

Metadata

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

items.content_html:
Summary

The term looks baseline first baseline, but they are actually separate values.

Motivation

There is a term baseline first baseline in the value list. It misleads it is a property value, but actually they are separate value baseline and first baseline. So it should be separated by commas.

Supporting details

Related issues

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

items.content_html:
Fixed the pug content for the View code block.
Issue is a duplicate of #9778 but for a different page on the express/node tutorial.

I've removed the summary/motivation etc, because they are the same as in #9778
If I shouldn't have done this, please let me know.

edit:
Sorry about that, I completely overlooked the part where it said : ! Do not make changes below this line !
So I tried to manually put back the info which I could find. I'm not sure about the validity of the last commit info in de report details.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/learn/server-side/express_nodejs/forms/create_bookinstance_form
  • MDN URL:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Server-side/Express_Nodejs/forms/Create_BookInstance_form#view
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/learn/server-side/express_nodejs/forms/create_bookinstance_form/index.md
  • Last commit: 07453ac

items.content_html:
FF94 introduces support for ShadowRoot.delegatesFocus.

This tidies the docs around this property and also adds a release note.

Other docs work tracked in #9364
items.title: FF94 ShadowRoot.delegatesFocus release note and tidy

items.content_html:
This PR converts https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide to Markdown.

Preparation PR: #9686.

Conversion report summary:

All unhandled elements

  • tr (14)
  • th[scope="row"] (10)
  • td[rowSpan="3"] (6)
  • table.standard-table (3)
  • td[rowSpan="5"] (3)
  • td[rowSpan="2"] (2)
  • th[rowSpan="2"][scope="row"] (1)

Full conversion report: https://gist.github.com/wbamberg/74041ada59777f272937dfaaf90bf54a.

The only unconverted elements are three tables:

  • one in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/Constraint_validation
  • two in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/Unicode_Bidrectional_Text_Algorithm (I just realised the slug for this page is wrong)

None of these should be convertible.
items.title: [Markdown][Web/Guide] Convert Web/Guide to Markdown - DO NOT SQUASH MERGE

items.content_html:
Summary

Inserts the preposition of in between the sample and the specification
Current: the sample the specification
My suggestion: the sample in the specification

It also links to the actual code of the sample in the specification repository.

Motivation

I believe that there is a missing of in preposition that links the part sample to the whole specification, at least it sounds better in my head with it.

Question: should we take advantage of this and also link to the actual example code of the specification repository?
I can't find the example code linked in the spec page, so perhaps it's useful to provide a direct link to it as it also has more examples.
Code example: https://github.com/WICG/visual-viewport/blob/gh-pages/examples/fixed-to-viewport.html
Spec page: https://wicg.github.io/visual-viewport/

It would end up like this:

The code below is based on [the sample in the specification](https://github.com/WICG/visual-viewport/blob/gh-pages/examples/fixed-to-viewport.html), though it adds

Supporting details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Visual_Viewport_API#example

Related issues

items.title: Missing preposition `in` on Visual Viewport API
